dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Ambulance took him away and May went-- The bottle breaks in Spider-Man’s clenching fist, the res sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt May, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was napping on the couch.  There was a voice and a shot I woke up.  Ben was looking at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’ll be fine. They won’t tell me anything, but I’m sure he’ll be fine. He sits beside her, watching her.  He hugs her, she respo head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle’s a brave old dude.  Evidently the guy was comin’ at your aunt, so he jumped him.  Caught a bullet, but chased the guy away.  Lucky thing a black-‘n’-white w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus-- Code Blue!  Crash cart in the lobby, Stat! A blur of action:  orderlies, nurses, a stretcher.  Marot Peter out of the line of “fire.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it, you chicken. He shoots a long web up to the warehouse roof, loops the hand, and swings-- -- above the stunned police. Reporters try to catch him o -- he arcs across the street to the warehouse, CRASHES th

dialogues.text: On the other side of the cavernous room, Spider-Man kicks bucket of red paint, which floods across the floor like a gunman, only half-visible in the dim, smoky light, whirls at Spider-Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ll kill you-- I’ll kill you!!! Bullets spray in every direction, exploding paint cans in of fluid and flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up here. The gunman looks up, aims at the ceiling-- Spider-Man han rafters.  Just as his trigger finger clenches, a jet of w the barrel of the gun, which BACKFIRES in his hands.  Spi down, his boot connects with the man’s jaw.  Spider-Man p stands above the unconscious gunman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up!  I want you to look into my eyes when I-- Spider-Man hoists the gunman off the floor in fury and pr the man’s skull. He hesitates… and sees the face of the G dancing firelight.

dialogues.text: Oh, no… (desperate)

dialogues.text: FROM  THE RAFTERS LIKE A YO-YO.  IT’S THE GUNMAN, MOANING ENVELOPED IN WEBBING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears off the mask.  Peter’s eyes are red-rimmed, past off his gloves:  one hand still bleeds from the crushed b the check from his waistband, stares at it… then slowly r pieces.  He stands, watching the confetti-like bits flutt violently rips the tunic from his chest.  He pauses:  we shooters still taped to his arms.  Peter throws the mask, down toward the street. As the blue and red costume drifts in the wind, pas an en WITH GREAT POWER COMES GREAT RESPONSIBILITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May would have liked the eulogy.  How is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay… the doctors say no shocks for a while.  She needs rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could use some too, honey. Peter nods, she hugs him.  A hefty, blue-collar FRIEND of awkward in a suit and tie, shakes Peter’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain’t nothing you coulda done, Peter. No nod to this one.  Peter watches the man walk off, then grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, we need a forklift for that pipe. (To Ock)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want the bill sent? Ock pulls a wad of crisp bills from his trench coat, hand astonished man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ll… uh… get you a receipt… He starts off into the warehouse, counting the cash, then heavy CLANK behind him.  He turns to see: The enormous section of pipe sitting in the truck bed.  O cab and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you let me go on about Rosomoff working me too hard? feel like a complete idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re not half the idiot I am, Harry. Adele and Liz set their trays on the adjoining table.  Fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look who’s dressing for success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least this ensemble doesn’t glow in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? He knows how to defend himself.  Maybe too well. Flash sits by Liz, waving a copy of the Bugle.  Peter’s p on page one-- with a barely perceptible rip down the midd reads: “TV CLOWN ESCAPES CRIME SCENE,” and subhead, “’Spi for questioning.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys.  Check it out-- I saw this dud on the tube las night. He is incredibly cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him too.  He was silly and obnoxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Flash isn’t?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, take pity on the feeble-minded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the insults pass him by)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, listen. They’re tryin’ to say he was in cahoots with this killer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash, drop it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but they got it all wrong.  Any fool can figure it out Spider-Man nailed this guy! Flash guzzles Liz’s glass of milk, to her annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Spidey is one guy I’d like to meet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toads of a feather… Adele notices the photo credit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter-- you took this picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see. Liz takes the paper, Flash reads it with her. Peter gets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, you amaze me!  You know this guy? Who is he, anyway?  Where did he come from?  Is he a cop, a martial arts freak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s a mistake. Peter walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mistake?  Hey, guy, get back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.  What a lump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing much. Harry rises with his and Peter’s coffee cups. HARRY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His aunt had a coronary.  His uncle was murdered by that guy Spider-Man caught.  No, nothing much at all. Harry exits, letting the news sink in. INT. ROSOMOFF’S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the last one to see Thorkel.  In Octavius’ hospital room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you’ve found Thorkel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of him… char-broiled bones. Teeth. We ruled out suicide.  Any bad blood between him and Ock? Roz gently takes the sextant away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Octavius wasn’t the murderer type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said he went off a little, after the accident, wh those mechanical arms--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waldos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. We have reason to believe he also robbed an armore truck and killed two men. With the waldos. Roz reacts to this, then leans over the map.  Marotta joi enters and stands politely by the door. Neither man notic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I’ve triangulated recent bizarre events-- the Bronx, Jersey, Brooklyn-- all rippling out from-- (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  The E.S.U. Science Center.  Octavius’ experiment seems to have opened a hole in space-time, drastically changing the interrelation between molecular binding, electromagnetism and gravity--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s fascinating, but I’m just a fat, dumb cop lookin’ for a psycho killer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There’s an infinitely greater danger. If-- (sees he won’t get through)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.  The only thing Octavius cares about is repeating his experiment.  To do that, he needs a radioactive catalyst, SL 270. He hands the cop a list.  Marotta nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toxic dumps, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he’ll need a cyclotron.  He can’t use ours-- he’s already destroyed it. (hands him a second list)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard every nuclear accelerator on the Eastern Seaboard. New Haven, Long Island, two in Cambridge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know him. Marotta recognizes Peter; Roz looks at him as well. They

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  Professor, I’m here about another extension.  My unc died. Roz looks at him dubiously, then sees he’s telling the tr slips the lists into his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a lot of ground to cover. We’ll try. (to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny coincidence, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such thing as coincidence.  “God does not play dice wi the universe.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein, right?  We’ll see ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter-- my condolences. Marotta walks out. Peter nods, turns to leave.  Roz picks Bugle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This photo you took of “Spider-Man”--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck.  The right place at the right time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  I’d like to speak with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t think I’ll be running into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know.  Go get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’ll try. Thanks. Roz turns back to his map.  Peter watches him for a momen INT.  PETER’S APARTMENT- DAY ON THE PHONE, TIE LOOSENED. WE HEAR REISS’ ANGRY SQUEALS RECEIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No… No, thanks, but… No, Mr. Reiss-- I’m finished with th act!… Okay, I’m a fool… Look, that’s it, no more Spider-M - I’m sorry.  Good-bye. He hangs up and flops face-down on the mattress, burying pillow. The PHONE RINGS. He glares at it, but answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What. INT.  JAMESON’S OFFICE - DAY ALL SMILES, JAMESON SITS ON HIS DESK, A COPY OF TODAY’S B JAMESON (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker, I love you.  We scooped every paper in the countr on this Spider-Man jerk!  I want more, Parker. I want mor A beat.  Jameson glares. JAMESON (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Aww, don’t be an ass!  Get pictures of him robbing bank, or kicking a dog-- anything!  This guy’s the best b guy since Mengele, or Son a’ Sam, or J.R. Ewing!… Eh?  Ge outta here, nobody wants a hero! INT.  PETE’S APARTMENT

dialogues.speaker: PETER LOOKS AT THE SQUEAKING RECEIVER, HANGS UP AND UNPLU
dialogues.text: INT. JAMESON’S OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: REPORT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this-- we sold out!  I’ll double the print run!  I’ll slot you on page one for the next month, buddy!  I’ll-- He finally notices the dead line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parker? (hangs up; to Betty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: NOVELTIES” BAG, ALONG WITH THE WEB-SHOOTERS AND THE OBNOX JACKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter! Wait a minute! He pauses, Liz runs up to him, a little breathless.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ PETER
dialogues.text: I was just coming by to apologize I’m sorry if I was-- Each pauses to let the other speak, then--

dialogues.speaker: LIZ PETER
dialogues.text: No, I didn’t know about--    I’ve been acting like a-- Both look at each other, then giggle. The tension eases. together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s in the bag?  Garbage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.  I’m returning the-- that outfit that you hated much.  Maybe I can get my money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t do it on my account--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wasn’t only you-- it -- it just wasn’t my style. Hey, look-- let’s go to lunch.  Someplace nice for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This from a man who winces at the cost of a pretzel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was then.  I’m better since the lobotomy. He points to an imaginary scar on his forehead; they laug

dialogues.text: Hey! Ock ignores him.  The Lineman pulls a heavy wrench from h brandishes it, approaching warily.  Without turning aroun waldo backward, grabs the wrench and crushes it in two. T off. Near the fence, the panicked Lineman slams into two GUARD female.

dialogues.text: My wrench!  He-- it-- arms! The guards draw their guns as he clambers over the fence. Another voltmeter needle swings as Ock throws a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!  Hands up! Ock turns, the waldos waving like Medusa’s hair.  The gua her bullet RICOCHETS off a telescoping metal arm.  It gra woman’s hand, squeezing.  A second waldo whips around the neck, shakes him like a terrier with a rat, then hurls hi wires. Electricity jolts his body and knocks him out.  Ock’s att his work.  Released, the woman falls to her knees in pain fallen comrade.  Her hand extends for his revolver.  But dragged away from the gun-- a waldo had her ankle.  She S waldo slaps her head, knocks her out. A voltmeter reads zero.  Ock frowns-- then spies a locked marked “Third Rail Circuit-- NY Transit Authority.”  Ock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but at least Aunt May’s okay now. I really have to sto by the hospital this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I come too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I’d like that. He ignores his dessert, stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep saying there’s nothing I could’ve done.  That’s lie.  I could’ve done something.  If only I’d paid attention to my feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re not trained for that.  None of us are… I mean, sometimes I… (practical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s say you had gone back.  What then?  Are you bulletproof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  The next day I’d read, “Peter Parker murdered,” and I’d feel…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’d feel what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.  You think you’re responsible for everything that happens.  Don’t flagellate yourself-- and don’t flatter yourself, either.  You’re not the center of the universe. You’re just…Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?  I’m not so sure. (looks at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be sure of a lot of things.  Oh, different thin from week to week, but now-- I’m not sure of anything anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean.  I… He looks a little queasy-- the spider-sense again.  Liz’s restaurant SOUND drop out, TRACK IN TO TIGHT CLOSE-UP on the Ock THROB and PANICKED CRIES of people in a subway ca Abruptly, we’re back to reality.  And Liz is being oddly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe unsure is-- good.  Maybe you feel more that way. Like I was sure you and I were just friends-- and that’s it.  But-- last weekend, when I was with Flash-- all I could think of was-- She sees Peter is paying absolutely no attention.  She ba against her glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  Earth to Peter.  Are you listening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unh-huh.  Excuse me.  I’ve gotta go. He grabs the Lieber’s bag and hurried out.  The waiter se before the boiling Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I really do hate him.

The drivers spin their steering wheels but magnetic attraction makes them slide through the inte together sideways and stick.  The drivers, inches apart, other, baffled. A taxi swerves around the wreck--

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: The PULSE spreads through the asphalt ahead, rippling mir The taxi’s wheels sink into the liquefying street, now th quicksand.  The driver crawls out his window and leaps to the gooey street swallows the cab. Spider-Man swings to the edge of an overlooking building, sink.  An earthquake-like RUMBLE from below. From beneath the street, a subway train BURSTS UP, arcs i

dialogues.speaker: ROAR--
dialogues.text: the three-car train sails through the air past Spider-Man a huge hole opens like an iris in the facade of a nearby building the train thrusts into the shimmering hole, which clamps The THROB and PULSE cease. The street below re-solidifies buried cars.  SCREAMS, HONKS, SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERTICAL.  A PILE OF A HALF-DOZEN COMMUTERS ON THE “BOTTO PANICKED CRIES: “GIVE ME A HAND--“  “WHAT--!”  “I WAS GOI BUS!”   “NOT THE DOOR!”  A WILD-EYED TEENAGER PULLS OPEN

dialogues.text: CRIES:  “THIS CITY’S NUTS!”  “GET THE FIRE DEPARTMENT!”

dialogues.text: SPIDER-MAN’S HEAD POPS IN AN OPEN WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. The passengers stare as he climbs in, backs them away fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, folks, stand back! He kicks it--nothing.  Frustrated, he grabs a metal raili passengers help him uproot it.  Spider-Man uses the pole ram, punching a hole in the window.  Office workers aid t Spider-Man runs toward the last car.

dialogues.text: DOOR AT THE “TOP” OF THE CAR, SCAMPERS DOWN THE GRAB-HAND BELOW.  THE HALF-DOZEN PASSENGERS CLING TO SEATS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavalry’s here-- get the wagons in a circle. He hefts a ROTUND WOMAN over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried Weight Watchers? She whacks him with her purse as he scampers straight up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let’s take  the scenic route.

dialogues.text: The iron link bends nearly open. Spider-Man fastens a thread of webbing to the outside of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First floor, ladies lingerie, sporting goods… He grabs the terrified man around the waist, then lets ou webbing in short bursts to lower himself and the man to t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where’s the hero?  I want to thank him personally for his fine-- An ominous GRATING of iron from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! It’s coming down! He scatters the crowd.  The Politico looks up at the subw runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no-- my limo-- my Mercedes! He scrambles to his car.  Spidey intercepts him, hefts hi potatoes and runs to cover as-- the subway car rips away from its link-- and falls, flattening the limo. Pieces scatter in every d Cameras click as Spider-Man sets the whimpering Politico

dialogues.text: My Mercedes…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all you need. He hands him the Mercedes hood ornament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you some kind of superhero?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I’m just trying to do as little harm as possibl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get your autograph?  Er-- for my kid, he’s a fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fans? I have fans? He starts to sign “Pete--, “ crosses it out, signs “Spide flourish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was here before it happened!  I bet he caused the whol thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He assaulted me!  I want him arrested!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Councilman, this guy just saved a whole buncha lives--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left.  I couldn’t believe it-- he just left!  It’s as he’s somewhere else… I’m only getting a piece of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Peter was little, he loved to hide.  In closets, und the sink.  He needed a secret place.  But when I’d look f him, he’d laugh… he wanted to be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure he does, toots.  May, gimme dat changer thingie. May flings the remote control across to the Crone’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Television is for idiots.  Read a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read this. The Crone gives May a ”fongoo” bent elbow.  Liz draws the the beds.

dialogues.text: I wish Ben said that to me, just once.  I never let up, always needling him, telling him what to do. Liz takes May’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I was hiding.  For years, I never told Ben the one important thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some things you should say anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if they’re not clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if you’ve heard them a million times in every stupid pop song ever written.

dialogues.text: What if you get hurt?

dialogues.text: Hey!  This is the truth!  Look, Doc Ock had this, uh, experiment thing, and the Science Center crashed into Central Park, and-- He spots Peter and Harry, holds up the Bugle.

dialogues.text: Oh. Well, hang in there, amigo. He crosses away.  Roz catches up to Peter from the lectur

dialogues.text: Peter-- I’m so very proud of you.  I must apologize for doubting that you could do it. Peter eyes him, wondering what he knows.  Roz eyes him ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you really apply yourself, you’ll get an A next time. Roz smiles wisely.  Peter watches him walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time… The idea of doing it all again makes Peter whistle lowly. across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  So very boring.  Peter Parker, how do you feel about me this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I… I like you.  A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.  Well, I like you, too.  I like your aunt.  I like yo shoelaces.  I like-- He holds a fingertip to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it.  Can we stop being clever, just for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? He kisses her.  She looks at him bittersweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may be the end of a beautiful friendship, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
